meanings.definition: The small, central scar on the abdomen marking the spot where the umbilical cord was attached in the womb.
meanings.sent1: Her navel is a tiny scar on her belly.
meanings.sent2: Babies have navels on their stomachs.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the navel was a mysterious button to press.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of life, our navels are the seeds of our existence.
meanings.sent5: The navel is like a hidden treasure map on the body.

meanings.definition: The central point or middle of a circle or other round object.
meanings.sent1: The navel of the clock is where the hands meet.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle always points towards the navel of the earth.
meanings.sent3: The pizza's navel oozed with melted cheese.
meanings.sent4: In the whirlwind of emotions, find peace at the navel of your thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The navel of the flower held a drop of morning dew.

meanings.definition: The central point or middle of a place or thing.
meanings.sent1: The navel of the city is its bustling downtown area.
meanings.sent2: In a book, the navel is often the climax of the story.
meanings.sent3: The cake's navel was the cherry on top.
meanings.sent4: The navel of the storm was eerily calm.
meanings.sent5: The navel of the forest was a serene clearing.
